page.title: 10West Southampton Schools 3
page.content: {Nursling Primary School}is a Church of England Controlled state school, on the edge of{Nursling}village. It is on the outskirts of{Southampton}but does not come within the Southampton Education Office Area. The headmaster,Mr D.J.Smart, told us it was opened in 1960. It is a day school and the pupils come from the village and surrounding area. There are{106 pupils}and{5 teachers but only{4 classes}. The largest class has 28 pupils, the smallest has 24. There is a school uniform. The school has a playing field, but does not have a swimming pool or a library. There is no school bus. They have three pianos, one computer, a tv and video. There are no showers. They do not set homework and they do have school discos. Being such a small school brings the danger of closure.
